alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; East Glacier Park Region; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 21 at 1:55AM MDT until April 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 6 inches. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and southwest Montana. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of snow are expected through this evening, with periods of heavier snow this afternoon and evening. The heavier bands of snow may reduce visibility down to a half mile or less and cause road surfaces to become slushy and or slippery.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
